author: Barchart
title: Hogs Rallying on Thursday
text:
Lean hog futures are trading with contracts up $2.07 to $2.45 so far on Thursday. The national average base hog negotiated price was reported at $79.35 on Thursday morning. The CME Lean Hog Index was reported at $81.05 on January 7, down 54 cents from the previous day.
USDAâ€™s FOB plant pork cutout value was up 13 cents in the Thursday AM report at $90.66 per cwt. The butt, picnic, and ham were reported lower, with the rest showing gains. Federally inspected hog slaughter on Tuesday was estimated at 490,000 head, with the weekly total at 1.424 million head. That is 104,357 head above the same week last year.
Feb 25 Hogs are at $81.925, up $2.450,
Apr 25 Hogs are at $87.150, up $2.075
May 25 Hogs is at $91.875, up $2.175,
